places.name: Alf√∂ld Gy√∂ngye Kalandpark
places.desc: 50-hectare adventure park with a 29-task rope course 4m up in the trees. Easier and harder routes, takes 1.5‚Äì2 hours. Forest setting is beautiful.
places.tip: Call ahead for winter hours. Bring gloves ‚Äî cables get cold.

places.name: √ìpusztaszer Eml√©kpark
places.desc: Where Hungarian tribal chiefs first gathered. The Feszty panorama ‚Äî a 120m circular painting of the conquest ‚Äî is mind-blowing. Skansen, monastery ruins, Nomad Park, yurts. Next door: Csillag√∂sv√©ny maze.
places.tip: Feszty panorama requires PRE-BOOKING in winter! Budget 3‚Äì4 hours.

places.name: Mak√≥ Town Walk + Lombkorona
places.desc: Tree-top walkway with bird's-eye views, J√≥zsef Attila Museum, veteran vehicle center with classic cars. The onion is a Hungarikum here ‚Äî you'll see it everywhere.
places.tip: Perfect half-day: morning Mak√≥ ‚Üí afternoon Hagymatikum. Walkway gorgeous in morning light.

places.name: Hagymatikum F√ºrd≈ë
places.desc: Makovecz Imre architecture ‚Äî breathtaking organic curves. 18 pools, cave pool with rainforest effects, 7 saunas, new 'Atlantisz' section (2024) with water bar. 41¬∞C medicinal water. Full wellness. Mon-Thu 9-20, Fri-Sat 9-22.
places.tip: Friday evening = night bathing vibes. Book couple's massage ahead. Weekdays to avoid crowds.

places.name: Gyop√°rosf√ºrd≈ë
places.desc: Low-key, less crowded than Mak√≥. Beautiful 50-hectare old parkland setting. Modern pools, wellness, medicinal water. Connected to the Kalandpark for active + thermal combo.
places.tip: Best when you want thermal without crowds. Nice with Orosh√°za's renovated f≈ët√©r.

places.name: Mindszent Cs√°rda
places.desc: 100+ year old cs√°rda with classic Hungarian comfort food. Tisza riverside walk after. The coziest half-day imaginable.
places.tip: Perfect lazy Sunday: long lunch with p√∂rk√∂lt and wine, Tisza walk, drive home.

places.name: Szentes
places.desc: Underrated gem. The Kurca stream through the center is called the 'green main street.' 71 bridges. P√©ter-P√°l Polg√°rh√°z Museum, vintage motorcycle collection, Sz√©chenyi Liget. Thermal bath with 15 pools.
places.tip: Kurca waterfront is lovely even in winter. Ask about the retro motorcycle collection.

places.name: Nagym√°gocsi Kast√©ly
places.desc: 19th century eclectic/neo-baroque castle with a nice park. Atmospheric and quiet. Sometimes hosts events.
places.tip: Works as a 1-hour stop on the way somewhere. Check if events are running.

places.name: Eml√©kpont M√∫zeum
places.desc: Communist era museum + first permanent Holocaust exhibition outside Budapest. Genuinely powerful. Alf√∂ldi Gal√©ria has rotating shows and annual V√°s√°rhelyi ≈êszi T√°rlat. Tornyai Museum for local art.
places.tip: For rainy days. One of the best museums in the region.

places.name: Orosh√°za F≈ët√©r Dining
places.desc: Renovated main square with restaurants, outdoor terraces, √úveg K√∂rtefa glass sculpture lit up at night, Art Nouveau G√©mes Palace. Hungary's only Well Museum (K√∫tm√∫zeum).
places.tip: Evening date: dinner on the lit-up f≈ët√©r, then thermal bath.

places.name: R√©gi H√≠d Vend√©gl≈ë
places.desc: Traditional Hungarian restaurant by the Tisza with exposed-brick walls and rustic-chic vibe. Famous for Szegedi hal√°szl√© (fish soup) and generous portions. Romantic candlelit atmosphere.
places.tip: Reserve ahead for riverside window seats. The fish soup is legendary but spicy!

places.name: Kisk≈ër√∂ssy Hal√°szcs√°rda
places.desc: Riverfront fish tavern with outdoor seating on the Tisza. Massive portions, live folk music on weekends, traditional Hungarian fish dishes paired with local wines.
places.tip: Come for sunset. The terrace jutting onto the water is pure magic in summer.

places.name: Szeged Dom
places.desc: Votive Church with 91m twin towers, stunning Neo-Romanesque architecture. Dom t√©r hosts open-air opera in summer. Climb the tower for panoramic views.
places.tip: Check for Szegedi Szabadt√©ri schedule (summer opera festival). Evening when lit up is breathtaking.

places.name: M√≥rahalom F√ºrd≈ë
places.desc: 21 pools including thermal, medical, adventure, and children's pools. Water from 2,300m deep. Modern winter bath opened in 2020. Set in beautiful Szent L√°szl√≥ park.
places.tip: Less touristy than others. Great for a quiet thermal day. Combine with Szeged visit.

places.name: Algy≈ë F√ºrd≈ë
places.desc: Family-friendly spa with 8 pools, slides, and wellness section. 42¬∞C thermal water helps rheumatism. Newly renovated facilities. Large green areas for picnics.
places.tip: Perfect for active couples ‚Äî spa + cycling on Tisza paths nearby.

places.name: K√∂r√∂s-Maros National Park
places.desc: Gateway to protected wetlands and forests. Guided tours, bird watching, canoeing on K√∂r√∂s. Mini-zoo with native species. Educational exhibits on Great Plain ecology.
places.tip: Best in spring for bird migration. Rent canoes for peaceful water exploration.

places.name: Szarvas Arbor√©tum
places.desc: 82-hectare botanical garden with over 1,600 plant species. Peacocks roam free. Small zoo with deer, goats. Romantic willow-lined paths, ponds, bridges.
places.tip: Morning is best ‚Äî peacocks are most active. Bring snacks for a picnic by the pond.

places.name: Szarvas Thermal Bath
places.desc: 6 covered pools including medical, thermal sitting, hot tub, training, and swimming. Modern facility, excellent for joint problems. Intimate atmosphere.
places.tip: Combine with arbor√©tum visit. Less crowded weekday mornings.

places.name: Gyula Castle
places.desc: Only intact brick Gothic castle on the Great Plain. Built early 15th century, survived Ottoman era. Summer castle theatre, medieval knights' hall, exhibitions. At night: beautifully lit.
places.tip: Catch a summer theatre performance in the courtyard. Magical setting.

places.name: Gyula V√°rf√ºrd≈ë
places.desc: Castle Bath ‚Äî thermal spa in park next to medieval castle. 10 pools, medicinal water, wellness. The setting is unique: soak while gazing at castle walls. Open-air pools stay open year-round.
places.tip: Evening bathing with castle floodlit is unforgettable. Book couple's massage in spa hotel.

places.name: Gyula Alm√°sy Kast√©ly
places.desc: Baroque castle of the Harruckern-Wenckheim-Alm√°sy family. First Hungarian castle to host stage plays (1746). Beautiful park, cultural events. Ferenc Erkel's grandfather lived here.
places.tip: Castle park is free to wander. Great photo spot. Check for classical concerts.

places.name: 100 Years Old Reinhardt Cukr√°szda
places.desc: Hungary's second-oldest continuously operating patisserie (since 1840). Historic ambience, authentic Hungarian cakes. Soml√≥i galuska, Esterh√°zy torte, t√∫r√≥ rudi. Coffee shop with 180+ year legacy.
places.tip: Try the Esterh√°zy cake ‚Äî it's legendary. Perfect afternoon date stop.

places.name: Szeged Riverside Walk
places.desc: Promenade along the Tisza from Roosevelt t√©r to Belv√°rosi Bridge. Tree-lined paths, benches, sunset views. Pass by historic buildings, cross ornate bridges. Street musicians in summer.
places.tip: Sunset walk followed by dinner at riverside restaurant. Bring a blanket for grass areas.

places.name: Hatos R√©tes Szeged
places.desc: Famous strudel shop with 20+ fillings, always freshly made. Sour cherry, poppy seed, cottage cheese, apple-walnut. Locals queue out the door. Tiny shop, huge reputation.
places.tip: Go early ‚Äî popular flavors sell out. Eat fresh while warm. Best strudel in southern Hungary.

places.name: Virag Cukr√°szda
places.desc: Historic 1920s confectionery, old-school Hungarian coffee house vibe. Try Grandma's Favorite (sugar-free, Hungary cake award 2022). Vintage decor, elegant pastries.
places.tip: Order coffee and m√∫zeumi r√©tes (museum strudel). Sit by window for people-watching.

places.name: Szeged Botanical Garden
places.desc: Peaceful 7-hectare garden with over 5,000 plant species. Japanese garden, rock garden, aquatic plants, greenhouse. University-owned, rarely crowded. Perfect for quiet dates.
places.tip: Spring is spectacular for blooms. Benches hidden among plants for intimate conversations.

places.name: Szeged Re√∂k Palace
places.desc: Stunning Art Nouveau palace (1907) by Ede Magyar. Flowing organic lines, pink and white facade. Now houses contemporary art exhibitions. One of Hungary's most beautiful Secession buildings.
places.tip: Even if museum's closed, the exterior is worth seeing. Golden hour photography is incredible.

places.name: Csongr√°d Thermal Bath
places.desc: 6 pools including thermal, training, children's pools. Covered and outdoor sections. Set in nice park. Water good for joint issues. Local favorite, not touristy.
places.tip: Combine with old town walk. Weekday afternoons are quietest.

places.name: T√°p√© Tisza Strand
places.desc: Natural Tisza river beach with grass, willows, and shallow water. SUP rentals, kayaking, swimming. Cs√°rda nearby. Summer vibes, less crowded than pools.
places.tip: July-August only. Bring picnic. Water shoes recommended for riverbed.

places.name: Sz≈ëreg Rosarium
places.desc: Rose garden with hundreds of varieties. Peak bloom May-June. Fragrant paths, benches, photo spots. Small but lovely. Free entry.
places.tip: Early June for peak blooms. Morning for best light and fragrance. Engagement photo favorite.

places.name: Csongr√°d-Bokros Wine Cellars
places.desc: Traditional wine cellars built into hillside. Taste Kadarka, K√©kfrankos, local wines. Small family wineries. Rustic atmosphere, sometimes with live music and grilled food.
places.tip: Call ahead to arrange tasting. Bring cash. The Kadarka is unique to the region.

places.name: Ap√°tfalva Pottery Workshop
places.desc: Traditional black pottery (fekete ker√°mia) workshop. Watch artisans work, try your hand at pottery wheel. Unique local craft. Buy handmade pieces.
places.tip: Book workshop session in advance. Great for creative couples. Pieces can be shipped if fragile.

places.name: Forr√°sk√∫t Recreation Area
places.desc: Large lake with beach, water sports, fishing. Cycling paths, picnic areas. Popular with locals, quieter than Tisza-t√≥. Windsurfing and SUP rentals.
places.tip: Summer weekends best. Bring picnic blanket. Good for active day: swim, cycle, paddleboard.

places.name: Deszk Horse Farm
places.desc: Traditional Hungarian horse farm. Horseback riding lessons, trail rides through countryside. Petting zoo with farm animals. Authentic puszta experience close to home.
places.tip: Book rides in advance. Even beginners welcome. Sunset rides available in summer.

places.name: Tisza-t√≥ South Beaches
places.desc: Hungary's second largest lake ‚Äî artificial but beautiful. Sandy beaches, shallow water, water sports. Sailing, windsurfing, kayaking. Several beach complexes.
places.tip: Summer weekends can be busy. Try Tiszaug beach for quieter vibe. Bring sunscreen.

places.name: Szeged Market Hall
places.desc: Vibrant local market with fresh produce, Pick salami, Szeged paprika, craft vendors. Upstairs food stalls serve l√°ngos, k√ºrt≈ëskal√°cs. Authentic local experience.
places.tip: Saturday mornings are liveliest. Try l√°ngos with sour cream and cheese ‚Äî cheap and delicious.

places.name: Szatymaz Stork Colony
places.desc: Village with 30+ stork nests on rooftops and poles. April-August, storks raise chicks. Observation platform, info boards. Authentic rural Hungary.
places.tip: May-June for chicks. Bring binoculars. Early morning for feeding activity.

places.name: Csanytelek Tisza Bridge
places.desc: Beautiful pedestrian bridge over the Tisza. Sunset spot, fishing, riverside walks. Small village charm. Nearby cs√°rda for traditional food.
places.tip: Perfect for a quiet evening. Watch the sunset from the bridge, then dinner at cs√°rda.

places.name: M√≥rahalom African Museum
places.desc: Unique museum with African art, hunting trophies, tribal artifacts. Built by local collector Nagy L√°szl√≥. Quirky but fascinating. Only one of its kind in the region.
places.tip: Call ahead for opening hours. Combine with thermal bath visit. Unexpectedly interesting.

places.name: √Åsotthalom Salt Hills
places.desc: Unique landscape created by ancient salt deposits. Small 'hills' on the flat puszta. Rare halophyte plants. Geological curiosity. Short trails for exploring.
places.tip: Not dramatic but geologically interesting. Best combined with M√≥rahalom or Szeged visit.

places.name: Csongr√°d Bels≈ëv√°ros
places.desc: Medieval street layout intact. K√©zm≈±vesh√°zak as living skansen. Unique baby doll collection, town museum, beautiful Tisza riverside. 26.7 km cycling route along the Tisza.
places.tip: Feels like stepping back in time. Combine cycling + Bels≈ëv√°ros walk.

places.name: B√©k√©scsaba
places.desc: World's largest Munk√°csy collection. Central Europe's largest Lutheran church. Walking street. Csabai kolb√°sz is local pride. J√≥kai Theatre for shows. Slovak heritage house.
places.tip: Check J√≥kai Theatre schedule. Dinner + show = underrated date.

places.name: P√≥steleki erd≈ë & Wenckheim Castles
places.desc: NATURA 2000 forest with ancient oaks, ironwood, blood beeches. The Wenckheim family built 17 castles ‚Äî the bicycle route connects them through countryside. 42 km total, pick your segment.
places.tip: Bring a backpack with snacks. Even a short segment between castles is gorgeous.

places.name: Szentesi F√ºrd≈ë
places.desc: 15 pools, 8 slides, saunas, sports pool. Set in Sz√©chenyi Liget park. Rarely overcrowded. New indoor pool.
places.tip: Sleeper pick. Combine with Szentes town walk.

places.name: Csillag√∂sv√©ny Maze
places.desc: Maze shaped like the wonder-stag from 3.5 km of privet hedges. History questions at junctions. Plus a 1,200m willow labyrinth. Genuinely fun for couples.
places.tip: Competitive or cooperative ‚Äî your call. Usually open March‚ÄìNovember.

places.name: Cserkesz≈ël≈ë F√ºrd≈ë
places.desc: Cult-favorite. Water from 2,300m deep at 82¬∞C. Online reviews are fanatical. 9 pools, modern winter bath. The Tiszazug area is beautiful cycling country.
places.tip: Legendary water for joints/back. Combine with Tiszak√ºrt Arboretum next door.

places.name: Tiszak√ºrt Arbor√©tum
places.desc: 60-hectare arboretum by the Tisza founded in the 1800s. 1000+ species, paved walking paths, wood carvings, 14m observation tower. Artesian mineral well you can drink from.
places.tip: Combine with Cserkesz≈ël≈ë. Best in May/October but beautiful year-round.

places.name: Gyomaendr≈ëd
places.desc: Town with 16 oxbow lakes ‚Äî unique in Hungary. Tree canopy walkway + tower in Erzs√©bet Liget. Fishing Experience Park on a dead river branch. Hungary's only printing museum.
places.tip: The lombkorona here is in a forest by a dead river ‚Äî atmospheric.

places.name: B√©k√©scsaba √Årp√°d F√ºrd≈ë
places.desc: Only year-round thermal facility in B√©k√©s County seat. 6 pools, barrier-free, large green areas, sports facilities. Modern renovation in 2003.
places.tip: County seat bath ‚Äî good value, big terraces. Combine with Munk√°csy Museum.

places.name: B√©k√©scsaba Munk√°csy Museum
places.desc: World's largest Munk√°csy collection. County museum founded 1899. Rotating exhibits, local history, art. The Munk√°csy paintings alone are worth the visit.
places.tip: Free on certain days. Check schedule. Combine with Lutheran church and walking street.

places.name: B√©k√©scsaba Lutheran Church
places.desc: Central Europe's largest Lutheran church. Built 1817, stunning neoclassical architecture. Massive pipe organ. Climb tower for city views. Slovak heritage center nearby.
places.tip: Free entry but donations appreciated. Sunday services have beautiful organ music.

places.name: Csabai Sausage Festival
places.desc: Annual October festival celebrating Csabai kolb√°sz (local salami/sausage). Hungarikum product. Tastings, cooking demos, craft fair, live music. Biggest food festival in the region.
places.tip: Mid-October. Book accommodation early. Try all the kolb√°sz varieties ‚Äî spicy is best.

places.name: Mez≈ëber√©ny Petrics Museum
places.desc: Orlai Petrics Soma Museum in beautiful Wenckheim castle. Historical painting collection. Castle built 1800s in Louis Seize-empire style. 5-hectare park. Pet≈ëfi connection ‚Äî his wife attended school here.
places.tip: Castle exterior alone worth seeing. Park is free. Small but quality collection inside.

places.name: Doboz Wenckheim Castle
places.desc: Wenckheim manor built 1805-1810. Castle park is nature conservation area. Neo-romanesque chapel nearby. Historically center of vast Wenckheim estates.
places.tip: Park is lovely for walks. Check if castle events are happening. Chapel is photogenic.

places.name: B√©k√©s-Tarhos Wenckheim Castle
places.desc: 19th century castle with 23-hectare arboretum. Former music school ‚Äî Gy√∂rgy Guly√°s opened singing school here 1946. Bandstand built 1953. B√©k√©s-Tarhos Music Days in summer.
places.tip: Castle is private property but arboretum accessible. Summer music festival is excellent.

places.name: Gyomaendr≈ëd Printing Museum
places.desc: Hungary's only printing museum. Historic presses, typography exhibits, bookbinding demonstrations. Hands-on activities. Unique niche museum.
places.tip: Call ahead for demos. Book lovers will geek out. Combine with oxbow lakes visit.

places.name: Gyomaendr≈ëd Liget Spa
places.desc: Thermal bath in Erzs√©bet Liget forest. Unique setting among oxbow lakes. 8 pools, wellness. Forest location makes it special ‚Äî swim surrounded by trees.
places.tip: Summer is best ‚Äî combine swimming with forest walks. Quieter than famous spas.

places.name: D√©vav√°nya Fishing Lake
places.desc: Large fishing lake complex, bird watching paradise. Hortob√°gy National Park territory. Rare water birds, herons, egrets. Fishing permits available. Observation towers.
places.tip: Spring migration is spectacular. Bring binoculars. Combine with Cserkesz≈ël≈ë spa nearby.

places.name: Sarkad Thermal Bath
places.desc: Family-friendly spa, 8 pools including thermal, adventure, children's. Water from 1,800m depth. New sections opened 2010. Good value, never crowded.
places.tip: Weekdays are very quiet. Good for budget thermal day. Small town charm nearby.

places.name: V√©szt≈ë-M√°gor Archaeological Site
places.desc: Neolithic settlement from 5500 BC. Reconstructed prehistoric houses, excavation site. One of Hungary's most important archaeological sites. Educational center.
places.tip: Fascinating for history buffs. Reconstructions give real sense of ancient life. Free entry.

places.name: Mez≈ëhegyes Stud Farm
places.desc: One of Europe's oldest state stud farms (1784). Breeds Nonius, Furioso, Gidran horses. Baroque buildings, horse shows, museum. Can visit stables, watch training.
places.tip: Call ahead for tour times. Horse shows on weekends. Architecture alone is impressive.

places.name: Battonya Serbian Church
places.desc: Beautiful Serbian Orthodox church with unique architecture. Serbian minority heritage. Iconostasis, frescoes. Small Serbian cultural museum nearby.
places.tip: Check opening hours ‚Äî often locked. Town has Serbian restaurants worth trying.

places.name: Tiszak√ºrt Arbor√©tum
places.desc: 60-hectare arboretum by the Tisza founded in the 1800s. 1000+ species, paved walking paths, wood carvings, 14m observation tower. Artesian mineral well you can drink from.
places.tip: Combine with Cserkesz≈ël≈ë. Best in May/October but beautiful year-round.

places.name: T√∫rkeve Pottery House
places.desc: Traditional pottery workshop with demonstrations. Famous T√∫rkeve pottery style. Buy handmade ceramics, try your hand at wheel. Folk art center.
places.tip: Book ahead for workshops. Great for unique souvenirs. Traditional Hungarian designs.

places.name: Mez≈ët√∫r Thermal Bath
places.desc: 5 pools: open medical, beach, children's, covered swimming pools. Set in park. Medicinal water for rheumatism. Traditional local spa.
places.tip: Very affordable. Combine with pottery museum in town. Authentic local experience.

places.name: Kunszentm√°rton Steppe
places.desc: Protected steppe landscape, rare plants, birdwatching. Traditional Great Plain scenery. Walking trails, observation points. Part of Kiskuns√°g National Park.
places.tip: Best spring for wildflowers. Bring good walking shoes. Vast horizons, incredible sunsets.

places.name: Tiszaf√ºred Pottery Workshop
places.desc: Famous for unique Tiszaf√ºred pottery style. Workshop visits, demonstrations, sales. Traditional designs, hand-painted. UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage.
places.tip: Buy directly from artisans. Prices better than Budapest. Watch painting process.

places.name: Tiszaf√ºred Bird Hospital
places.desc: Rehabilitation center for injured wild birds. Educational programs, can see rescued birds up close. Eagles, owls, storks being treated. Unique experience.
places.tip: Call ahead for visiting hours. Donations appreciated. Great for animal lovers.

places.name: Kecskem√©t
places.desc: Hungary's 7th largest city. Cifrapalota (stunning Art Nouveau), Lechner-designed V√°rosh√°za, Toy Museum, Photography Museum, Science House. Home of barack p√°linka. Always lively.
places.tip: Architecture is incredible. P√°linka tasting is THE thing. Great date city.

places.name: Bugac Puszta
places.desc: THE iconic puszta experience. Horse shows with csik√≥s doing the legendary 'puszta five,' shepherd museum, indigenous animal zoo, ancient juniper forest. Eat at Karik√°s Cs√°rda after.
places.tip: Check horse show schedule ‚Äî not daily. Full day trip.

places.name: Debrecen
places.desc: Hungary's 2nd largest city. The Great Reformed Church, D√©ri Museum, amazing restaurant scene. The Nagyerd≈ë park and Aquaticum thermal bath complex. University campus is beautiful.
places.tip: Worth a full day. The D√©ri Museum's Munk√°csy trilogy is legendary.

places.name: Hortob√°gy Nemzeti Park
places.desc: UNESCO World Heritage puszta. The Nine-Arch Bridge is iconic. Horse shows, shepherd demonstrations, traditional Hortob√°gy cs√°rda, bird watching (huge migration spot). Unique landscape unlike anything else.
places.tip: Best in spring/autumn for bird migration. The cs√°rda here is one of Hungary's oldest.

places.name: Tisza-t√≥ Ab√°dszal√≥k Beach
places.desc: Main beach area of Tisza Lake. Sandy beaches, water sports rentals, restaurants. Sailing school, windsurfing, kitesurfing. Summer resort vibe.
places.tip: Book accommodation ahead for summer. Great for active water sports weekend.

places.name: Tiszaf√ºred Thermal Bath
places.desc: Large bath complex on Tisza Lake shore. Indoor and outdoor pools, wellness, slides. Beautiful setting. Combine lake activities with thermal relaxation.
places.tip: Off-season best for avoiding crowds. Lake views from outdoor pools.

places.name: J√°szber√©ny Zoo & Botanical Garden
places.desc: Regional zoo with 300+ animal species. Large botanical collection. Playgrounds, petting zoo. Well-maintained, family-friendly but great for adult couples too.
places.tip: Spring is best for baby animals. Budget 3-4 hours. Picnic areas available.

places.name: Szolnok Thermal Bath
places.desc: Large thermal complex on Tisza riverside. 12 pools including thermal, medical, adventure, wave pool. Wellness center. Modern facilities.
places.tip: Combine with Szolnok old town walk. Riverside location is beautiful.

places.name: Szolnok Gallery
places.desc: Famous artists' colony history. Gallery showcases Szolnok school painters. Beautiful riverside setting. Contemporary and historical Hungarian art.
places.tip: Free entry certain days. Riverside walk after. Szolnok has strong art tradition.

places.name: Tisza-t√≥ Eco-Center
places.desc: Interactive natural history museum about Tisza Lake ecology. Aquarium with local fish, wetland exhibits, observation tower. Educational but fun.
places.tip: Great for rainy days. Tower has panoramic lake views. Combine with lake activities.

places.name: Kis√∫jsz√°ll√°s Pottery Museum
places.desc: Traditional S√°rk√∂z pottery collection. Museum in historic building. Demonstrations on weekends. Unique regional pottery style.
places.tip: Check demo schedule. Buy authentic pieces directly. Traditional designs.

places.name: Hajd√∫szoboszl√≥ Thermal Bath
places.desc: One of Hungary's largest spa complexes. 13 pools, aquapark, medical section. Huge outdoor area. Famous for iodine-rich water. Can easily spend full day.
places.tip: Summer is crowded but fun. Medical section quieter. Bring sunscreen for outdoor pools.

places.name: Hajd√∫szoboszl√≥ Greek Catholic Church
places.desc: Beautiful Greek Catholic church with ornate iconostasis. Unique architecture for the region. Colorful interior, religious art.
places.tip: Combine with thermal bath visit. Opening hours limited, check ahead.

places.name: Nagykuns√°g Steppe
places.desc: Protected steppe landscape, part of Hortob√°gy National Park. Traditional puszta ecosystem. Birdwatching, rare plants, shepherd culture. Vast open spaces.
places.tip: Spring for wildflowers and birds. Bring good walking shoes. Authentic Great Plain.

places.name: Budapest
places.desc: The capital needs no introduction. Buda Castle, Parliament, ruin bars, Sz√©chenyi/Rudas/Gell√©rt baths, Danube cruise, incredible food scene. Every couple should do a Budapest weekend at least once a year.
places.tip: Book a boutique hotel in District VII. Friday night ruin bars ‚Üí Saturday culture ‚Üí Sunday thermal.

places.name: Eger
places.desc: One of Hungary's most beautiful cities. Baroque architecture, Eger Castle, the famous Sz√©passzony-v√∂lgy (Valley of Beautiful Women) wine cellars. Egri Bikav√©r (Bull's Blood) wine. The minaret is the northernmost Ottoman relic in Europe. Thermal bath in the city center.
places.tip: Stay overnight. Wine tasting in the valley is a must. The castle views at sunset are insane.

places.name: Miskolctapolca Barlangf√ºrd≈ë
places.desc: Europe's unique cave thermal bath ‚Äî you swim through actual natural caves. The water is warm and the atmosphere is magical. Nearby: Di√≥sgy≈ër Castle and Lillaf√ºred with its waterfall and hanging gardens.
places.tip: Combine with Lillaf√ºred for a weekend. The cave bath alone is worth the drive.

places.name: Tokaj Wine Region
places.desc: UNESCO World Heritage wine region. The legendary Tokaji Asz√∫ ‚Äî Louis XIV called it 'wine of kings, king of wines.' Ancient cellars, furmint tastings, Zempl√©n mountain backdrop. Gorgeous riverside town.
places.tip: Stay 2 nights. Winery visits + cellar tastings + riverside walks. Hotel Minaro is excellent.

places.name: P√©cs
places.desc: Mediterranean vibes in Hungary. The Mosque Church (G√°zi K√°szim pasa dzs√°mija) is stunning. Roman necropolis (UNESCO), Zsolnay Cultural Quarter, amazing gastro scene. Warm even in winter. Combine with Vill√°ny wine region (30 min away).
places.tip: Stay 2 nights: Day 1 P√©cs, Day 2 Vill√°ny wine route. The Zsolnay Quarter alone is worth it.

places.name: Vill√°ny Wine Route
places.desc: Hungary's 'Red Wine Capital.' Famous for bold Cabernet Franc. Hungary's first dedicated wine trail. Beautiful sculpture park among the vineyards. Combine with P√©cs for the ultimate weekend.
places.tip: Sauska, Gere, Vylyan are top wineries. Book tastings ahead.

places.name: Balaton (North Shore)
places.desc: The 'Hungarian Sea.' Tihany Abbey with lavender fields and stunning lake views. Balatonf√ºred is the old-money spa town with beautiful promenades. Wine tasting along the north shore. Even in off-season, it's gorgeous and uncrowded.
places.tip: Stay in Balatonf√ºred or Tihany. Off-season is actually better ‚Äî no crowds, same views. The wine is excellent.

places.name: H√©v√≠z Thermal Lake
places.desc: The world's largest biologically active natural thermal lake. You literally swim in a warm lake surrounded by water lilies. Open year-round ‚Äî swimming in winter steam is magical. Nearby: Keszthely with its Festetics Palace.
places.tip: Combine with Balaton north shore for a 3-day trip. The winter steam experience is unforgettable.

places.name: Szentendre
places.desc: Artsy riverside town near Budapest. Cobblestone streets, colorful buildings, galleries everywhere, Serbian churches, marzipan museum. Perfect for a wandering afternoon. Often combined with a Budapest trip.
places.tip: Makes a great Saturday day trip if you're already in Budapest for the weekend.

places.name: Lillaf√ºred
places.desc: Fairy-tale setting in the B√ºkk mountains. Hanging gardens, waterfall, cave systems (Istv√°n-barlang + Anna-barlang), the palatial Hotel Palota on a lake. Forest hiking trails everywhere.
places.tip: Combine with Miskolctapolca cave bath for the ultimate nature + thermal weekend.

places.name: Holl√≥k≈ë
places.desc: UNESCO World Heritage village ‚Äî perfectly preserved Pal√≥c folk architecture. The castle overlooks everything. Feels like stepping into the 18th century. Famous Easter festival with traditional costumes.
places.tip: Best at Easter for the festival, but charming year-round. The castle hike is short but rewarding.

places.name: Aggtelek Caves
places.desc: UNESCO-listed Baradla cave system ‚Äî one of Europe's most impressive. Stalactites, underground rivers, concert hall inside. Different tour lengths available (1‚Äì7 hours). The surrounding national park has great hiking.
places.tip: Book the medium-length tour (2.5 hrs). The acoustics tour with music is unforgettable.

places.name: Sz√©kesfeh√©rv√°r
places.desc: Ancient coronation city of Hungarian kings. Ruins Garden (medieval basilica remains), Bory Castle (one man's 40-year art project), beautiful baroque center, good restaurants.
places.tip: Bory Castle is unlike anything else ‚Äî built by one man over his lifetime. Genuinely wild.
